title: SemConvSpec
description:
A semantic convention file as defined [here](/schemas/semconv-syntax.md)
A semconv file either follows version 1 or 2.  Default is version 1.

anyOf.description: Semantic convention specification that includes a version tag.
Semantic convention specification that does NOT include a version tag.

AnyValueSpec.description: The AnyValueTypeSpec is a specification of a value that can be of any type.

brief.description: A brief description of the value

examples.description:
Sequence of examples for the value or single example
value. If only a single example is provided, it can
directly be reported without encapsulating it
into a sequence/dictionary.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the enum entry.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the value.
It defaults to an empty string.

requirement_level.description:
Specifies if the field is mandatory. Can be "required",
"conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted,
the field is "recommended". When set to
"conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST
specify the conditions under which the field is required.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the value.

brief.description: A brief description of the value

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the value.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

examples.description:
Sequence of example values for the attribute or single example
value. They are required only for string and string array
attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the
attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly
be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

key.description: String that uniquely identifies the attribute.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

type.description:
Either a string literal denoting the type as a primitive or an
array type, a template type or an enum definition.

attributes.description: List of attributes and group references that belong to this group

id.description: The name of the attribute group, must be unique.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

attributes.description: List of attributes and group references that belong to this group

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

id.description: The name of the attribute group, must be unique.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

AttributeOrGroupRef.description: A reference to either an attribute or an attribute group.

AttributeRef.description: A refinement of an Attribute for a signal.

annotations.description:
Additional annotations for the attribute. These will be
merged with annotations from the definition.

brief.description: Refines the brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated for this signal.

examples.description:
Refined sequence of example values for the attribute or single example
value. They are required only for string and string array
attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the
attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly
be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

note.description: Refines the more elaborate description of the attribute.

ref.description: Reference an existing attribute by key.

requirement_level.description:
Refines the attribute requirement level. Can be "required",
"conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted,
the original attribute requirement level is used. When set to
"conditionally_required", the string provided as `condition` MUST
specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

stability.description:
Refines the stability of the attribute.
This denotes whether an attribute is stable for a specific
signal.

AttributeRole.description: The different roles for attributes in groups.

oneOf.description: The attribute is considered identifying for the signal it is associated with.
The attribute is considered descriptive for the signal it is associated with.

AttributeSpec.description:
A reference to an attribute or a local definition of an attribute.
For a reference to an attribute, only the `ref` field is required.
For a locally defined attribute, the fields `id`, `type`, `requirement_level`, and `note` are required.

anyOf.description:
Reference to another attribute.

ref MUST have an id of an existing attribute.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated.

examples.description:
Sequence of example values for the attribute or single example
value. They are required only for string and string array
attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the
attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly
be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute.
It defaults to an empty string.

prefix.description:
Specifies the prefix of the attribute.
If this parameter is set, the resolved id of the referenced attribute will
have group prefix added to it.
It defaults to false.

requirement_level.description:
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory. Can be "required",
"conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted,
the attribute is "recommended". When set to
"conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST
specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

role.description: Whether the attribute is identifying or descriptive.

sampling_relevant.description:
Specifies if the attribute is (especially) relevant for sampling
and thus should be set at span start. It defaults to false.
Note: this field is experimental.

stability.description:
Specifies the stability of the attribute.
Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will
automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is
present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an
error.

tag.description:
Associates a tag ("sub-group") to the attribute. It carries no
particular semantic meaning but can be used e.g. for filtering
in the markdown generator.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated.

examples.description:
Sequence of example values for the attribute or single example
value. They are required only for string and string array
attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the
attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly
be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the attribute.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute.
It defaults to an empty string.

requirement_level.description:
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory. Can be "required",
"conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted,
the attribute is "recommended". When set to
"conditionally_required", the string provided as <condition> MUST
specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

role.description: Whether the attribute is identifying or descriptive.

sampling_relevant.description:
Specifies if the attribute is (especially) relevant for sampling
and thus should be set at span start. It defaults to false.
Note: this field is experimental.

stability.description:
Specifies the stability of the attribute.
Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will
automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is
present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an
error.

tag.description:
Associates a tag ("sub-group") to the attribute. It carries no
particular semantic meaning but can be used e.g. for filtering
in the markdown generator.

type.description:
Either a string literal denoting the type as a primitive or an
array type, a template type or an enum definition.

BasicRequirementLevelSpec.description: The different types of basic requirement levels.

Deprecated.description: The different ways to deprecate an attribute, a metric, ...

oneOf.description:
The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been renamed to an
existing or a new telemetry object.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

renamed_to.description: The new name of the telemetry object.

oneOf.description:
The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been obsoleted
because it no longer exists and has no valid replacement.

The `brief` field should contain the reason why the field has been obsoleted.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

oneOf.description:
The telemetry object containing the deprecated field has been deprecated for
complex reasons (split, merge, ...) which are currently not precisely defined
in the supported deprecation reasons.

The `brief` field should contain the reason for this uncategorized deprecation.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

oneOf.description:
This variant is used to capture old, unstructured deprecated "string".
Used for backward-compatibility only.

note.description: The note to provide more context about the deprecation.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

description.description: The attributes that make the description of the Entity.

identity.description: The attributes that make the identity of the Entity.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

brief.description:
Brief description of the enum entry value.
It defaults to the value of id.

id.description: String that uniquely identifies the enum entry.

note.description:
Longer description.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Stability of this enum value.

value.description: String, int, or boolean; value of the enum entry.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

attributes.description: List of attributes that belong to the semantic convention.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

entity_associations.description: Which resources this event should be associated with.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

anyOf.description: List of arrays of integers example.
List of arrays of doubles example.
List of arrays of bools example.
List of arrays of strings example.

GroupRef.description: A reference to an attribute group.

ref_group.description: Reference an existing attribute group by id.

GroupSpec.description:
A group defines an attribute group, an entity, or a signal.
Supported group types are: `attribute_group`, `span`, `event`, `metric`, `entity`, `scope`.
Mandatory fields are: `id` and `brief`.

Note: The `resource` type is no longer used and is an alias for `entity`.

attributes.description: List of attributes that belong to the semantic convention.

body.description:
The event body definition
Note: only valid if type is event

brief.description: A brief description of the semantic convention.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as <description> MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

display_name.description: The readable name for attribute groups used when generating registry tables.

entity_associations.description:
Which resources this group should be associated with.
Note: this is only viable for span, metric and event groups.

events.description:
List of strings that specify the ids of event semantic conventions
associated with this span semantic convention.
Note: only valid if type is span

extends.description:
Reference another semantic convention id. It inherits all
attributes defined in the specified semantic
convention.

id.description: The id that uniquely identifies the semantic convention.

instrument.description:
The instrument type that should be used to record the metric. Note that
the semantic conventions must be written using the names of the
synchronous instrument types (counter, gauge, updowncounter and
histogram).
For more details: [Metrics semantic conventions - Instrument types](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-types).
Note: This field is required if type is metric.

metric_name.description:
The metric name as described by the [OpenTelemetry Specification](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/main/specification/metrics/data-model.md#timeseries-model).
Note: This field is required if type is metric.

name.description:
The name of the event (valid only when the group `type` is `event`).

Note: If not specified, the prefix is used. If the prefix is empty (or unspecified), the name is required.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the semantic convention.
It defaults to an empty string.

prefix.description:
Prefix for the attributes for this semantic convention.
It defaults to an empty string.

span_kind.description:
Specifies the kind of the span.
Note: only valid if type is span

stability.description:
Specifies the stability of the semantic convention.
Note that, if stability is missing but deprecated is present, it will
automatically set the stability to deprecated. If deprecated is
present and stability differs from deprecated, this will result in an
error.

type.description: The type of the semantic convention.

unit.description:
The unit in which the metric is measured, which should adhere to the
[guidelines](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-units).
Note: This field is required if type is metric.

GroupType.description:
The different types of groups: `attribute_group`, `span`, `event`, `metric`, `entity`, `scope`.

Note: The `resource` type is no longer used and is an alias for `entity`.

oneOf.description:
Attribute group (attribute_group type) defines a set of attributes that
can be declared once and referenced by semantic conventions for
different signals, for example spans and logs. Attribute groups don't
have any specific fields and follow the general semconv semantics.

The metric group semconv is a group where related metric attributes can
be defined and then referenced from other metric groups using ref.

GroupWildcard.description:
Represents a wildcard expression to import one or several groups defined in an imported
registry.

Imports.description: Imports are used to reference groups defined in a dependent registry.

entities.description: A list of entity group name wildcards.

events.description: A list of event group name wildcards.

metrics.description: A list of metric group metric_name wildcards.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

attributes.description: List of attributes that belong to the semantic convention.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

entity_associations.description: Which resources this metric should be associated with.

instrument.description:
The instrument type that should be used to record the metric. Note that
the semantic conventions must be written using the names of the
synchronous instrument types (counter, gauge, updowncounter and
histogram).
For more details: [Metrics semantic conventions - Instrument types](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-types).
Note: This field is required if type is metric.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

unit.description:
The unit in which the metric is measured, which should adhere to the
[guidelines](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/main/specification/metrics/semantic_conventions#instrument-units).

oneOf.description: A double attribute (double precision floating point (IEEE 754-1985)).
An any type attribute (accepts any valid value).

SemConvSpecV1.description:
A semantic convention file as defined [here](/schemas/semconv.schema.json)
A semconv file is a collection of semantic convention groups (i.e. [`GroupSpec`]).

groups.description: A collection of semantic convention groups or [`GroupSpec`].

imports.description: A list of imports referencing groups defined in a dependent registry.

SignalId.description: An identifier for a signal.  Should be `.` separated namespaces and names.

annotations.description: Annotations for the attribute or signal.

attributes.description: List of attributes that belong to the semantic convention.

brief.description: A brief description of the attribute or signal.

deprecated.description:
Specifies if the semantic convention is deprecated. The string
provided as description MUST specify why it's deprecated and/or what
to use instead. See also stability.

entity_associations.description: Which resources this span should be associated with.

kind.description:
Specifies the kind of the span.
Note: only valid if type is span

name.description: The name pattern for the span.

note.description:
A more elaborate description of the attribute or signal.
It defaults to an empty string.

stability.description: Specifies the stability of the attribute or signal.

type.description:
The type of the Span. This denotes the identity
of the "shape" of this span, and must be unique.

SpanAttributeOrGroupRef.description: A reference to either a span attribute or an attribute group.

SpanAttributeRef.description: A refinement of an Attribute for a span.

annotations.description:
Additional annotations for the attribute. These will be
merged with annotations from the definition.

brief.description: Refines the brief description of the attribute.

deprecated.description: Specifies if the attribute is deprecated for this signal.

examples.description:
Refined sequence of example values for the attribute or single example
value. They are required only for string and string array
attributes. Example values must be of the same type of the
attribute. If only a single example is provided, it can directly
be reported without encapsulating it into a sequence/dictionary.

note.description: Refines the more elaborate description of the attribute.

ref.description: Reference an existing attribute by key.

requirement_level.description:
Refines the attribute requirement level. Can be "required",
"conditionally_required", "recommended" or "opt_in". When omitted,
the original attribute requirement level is used. When set to
"conditionally_required", the string provided as `condition` MUST
specify the conditions under which the attribute is required.

sampling_relevant.description:
Specifies if the attribute is (especially) relevant for sampling
and thus should be set at span start. It defaults to false.
Note: this field is experimental.

stability.description:
Refines the stability of the attribute.
This denotes whether an attribute is stable for a specific
signal.

SpanGroupRef.description: A reference to an attribute group for spans.

ref_group.description: Reference an existing attribute group by id.

note.description: Required description of how a span name should be created.

Stability.description: The level of stability for a definition. Defined in [OTEP-232](https://github.com/open-telemetry/oteps/blob/main/text/0232-maturity-of-otel.md)

oneOf.description: A definition in development. Formally known as experimental.
Version 1 of the semantic convention schema.

groups.description: A collection of semantic convention groups or [`GroupSpec`].

imports.description: A list of imports referencing groups defined in a dependent registry.

oneOf.description: Version 2 of the semantic convention schema.

attribute_groups.description: A collection of semantic conventions for AttributeGroups.

attributes.description: A collection of semantic conventions for attributes.

entities.description: A collection of semantic conventions for Entity signals.

events.description: A collection of semantic conventions for Event signals.

imports.description: A list of imports referencing groups defined in a dependent registry.

metrics.description: A collection of semantic conventions for Metric signals.

spans.description: A collection of semantic conventions for Span signals.
